posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
An unarmed dwarven STR mnk6/ftr4 will glean the most from 10 levels IMO.  Max Conc (vs. Taunt), Discipline, Listen, Tumble 10.  You should be able to get an additional save vs. spells in that mix as well.  You can go with a pure monk but miss 3 feats, a bit of damage and an AB (+13).

Suggested ability spread: STR 18 (20), DEX 8, CON 14, WIS 14, INT 12, CHA 6.
Suggested feats: Lightning reflex, WF/WS, SkF: Disc and Conc, Blind Fight, Extra stuns (total=9x/day).

Unfortunately, only warrior types can qualify for ImpCrit within 10 levels so that's your handicap going with a 3/4 primary class.  Final progression should be something like +14/+11/+8 (or +12/+9/+6/+3 w/FoB).

The stun DC is rather good.  At Level 10, it will be 17 vs. Fort.

Monk 6 gets all the combat feats but misses out on ImpEvasion.  Reflex is nothing to write home about anyway without finessing the attack (Empyre already posted the finessed versions for you).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you start with STR 16, you can boost your DEX to 14. You would lose 1 AB but gain 3 AC (and +3 on Reflex saves).
